title: Catch::session()run crashes with argc == 0
body:
Catch 1.5.7, Xcode 8, OS X 10.11.6

We had some code that was stripping the binary name before passing argc/argv on to catch. With 1.5.7 that causes a crash because Catch is blindly dereferencing a vector[0] at line 4519 of the single header:

```
* thread #1: tid = 0x2a7dc70, 0x00007fff8699e254 libc++.1.dylib`std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> >::basic_string(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&) + 4, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=1, address=0x0)
- frame #0: 0x00007fff8699e254 libc++.1.dylib`std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> >::basic_string(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&) + 4
  frame #1: 0x00000001000f49bc lib_tests`Catch::Clara::CommandLineCatch::ConfigData::parseInto(this=0x00007fff5fbff5c8, args=size=0, config=0x00007fff5fbff628) const + 124 at catch.hpp:4519
  frame #2: 0x00000001000f428f lib_tests`Catch::Session::applyCommandLine(this=0x00007fff5fbff5c0, argc=0, argv=0x00007fff5fbff740, unusedOptionBehaviour=Fail) + 175 at catch.hpp:6363
  frame #3: 0x00000001000e295a lib_tests`Catch::Session::run(this=0x00007fff5fbff5c0, argc=0, argv=0x00007fff5fbff740) + 58 at catch.hpp:6389
  frame #4: 0x00000001000a681b lib_tests`(anonymous namespace)::catch_main(argc=0, argv=0x00007fff5fbff740) + 59 at main.cpp:59
  frame #5: 0x00000001000a6790 lib_tests`main(argc=1, argv=0x00007fff5fbff748) + 48 at main.cpp:15
```
I've removed the legacy code that did this, but Catch should not be making this assumption.
